text: Anna Soubry to Nigel Farage ‘how’s the march going Nigel How many have you employed to go on your march?’
author: nedsimons

text: Labour chairman Ian Lavery: ‘We want Brexit, but we want the Labour Brexit.’
author: nedsimons

text:
John Bercow tells MPs: ‘None of you is a traitor. All of you are doing your best.’ 

Adds: ‘The sole duty of every MP is to do what he or she thinks is right.’
author: nedsimons

text: Labour chairman Ian Lavery apologises for Jeremy Corbyn missing local election campaign launch as he is in Brussels ‘fixing Brexit’
author: nedsimons

text: Andrea Leadsom: ‘we intend to bring forward proposals for a third meaningful vote.’
author: nedsimons

text: In the Commons, John Bercow asked about allowing MV3. Says he will not comment ‘on the hoof’, ‘I will rule as and when it is necessary to do so. That moment is not now.’
author: nedsimons

text: Jeremy Hunt says Theresa May’s Brexit deal ‘could give us everything we want’ ...if we ‘negotiate well’. #r4today
author: nedsimons

text: Lisa Nandy says Theresa May’s speech tonight was an ‘attack on liberal democracy itself’ #peston
author: nedsimons

text: May repeats again: 'As PM, as far as I concerned, there will be no delay in delivering Brexit beyond June 30.' #PMQs
author: nedsimons

text: Meanwhile, Tory Chairman Brandon Lewis emails with '3.6 million reasons to support' the Conservatives.
author: nedsimons

text: Theresa May seems to be hinting she'll quit rather than ask for long Article 50 extension. 'As prime minister, I am not prepared to delay Brexit any further than 30 June.'
author: nedsimons

text: Tory MP Peter Bone tells Theresa May: ‘If you continue to apply for an extension for Article 50, you will be betraying the British people.’ #PMQs
author: nedsimons

text: Theresa May says the Commons has ‘indulged itself on Europe for too long’ #PMQs
author: nedsimons

text: Theresa May formally announces she has written to the EU asking for an Article 50 extension to June 30  #pmqs
author: nedsimons

text: Laura Pidcock lukewarm on a second referendum, says it ’might have to be an option at some point’
author: nedsimons

text: Tory MP Nigel Huddleston: ‘I don’t think there is anything wrong with Liz Truss.’ #EmmaBarnettShow
author: nedsimons

text: Leadsom adds of Bercow: 'some people do have concerns about his impartiality... I’ve had some questions.'
author: nedsimons

text: Andrea Leadsom says when she was told John Bercow was making a statement she assumed it would be about ‘Arsenal winning a match’
author: nedsimons

text: Andrea Leadsom on LBC: ‘I feel that the PM’s entire cabinet needs to remain focused on getting us out of the EU.’
author: nedsimons

text: This is the worst thing
author: nedsimons

text: Michel Barnier: 'Extending the uncertainty without a clear plan would add to the economic cost for our businesses, but could also incur a political cost for the EU.'
author: nedsimons

text: Tory MP Robert Halfon on @HuffPostUKPol says Brexiteers must not be 'puritanical' and 'accept what’s on the table for now, with the possibility of a better meal in the future'
author: nedsimons

text: Stephen Barclay asked if he will vote for a long extension. ‘I don’t think my constituents want to see a long delay.’ #r4today
author: nedsimons

text: Stephen Barclay: 'There is a growing risk of no Brexit.' #r4today
author: nedsimons

text: Oh god.
author: nedsimons

text: Justine Greening says it’s not ‘not appropriate or credible’ for Stephen Barclay to negotiate any extension to Article 50 because he voted against it.
author: nedsimons

text: John McDonnell last night ‘I bloody well wish we could’ get ‘Brexit out the way’.
author: nedsimons

text: John Bercow: 'I’ve never lost a wink of sleep over any work related matter.’
author: nedsimons

text: Security minister Ben Wallace says intelligence services and police ‘want us to get on with delivering a Brexit’ and ‘despair’ at idea of collapse of government or parliament #r4today
author: nedsimons

text: Jeremy Corbyn suggests Labour will call a vote of no confidence in the government next week if MPs reject the Brexit deal for a third time #ridge
author: nedsimons

text: Jeremy Corbyn says he could vote to leave the EU in any second referendum if he thinks the Brexit deal on the table is a good one.
author: nedsimons

text: Liam Fox says government could pull meaningful vote on Brexit deal next week if it thinks it will lose #Ridge
author: nedsimons
